gobblin.instrumented

Class Instrumented

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.instrumented.Instrumented
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Instrumentable, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class Instrumented
extends Object
implements Instrumentable, Closeable
    Provides simple instrumentation for gobblin-core components.

    Creates MetricContext. Tries to read the name of the parent context from key "metrics.context.name" at state, and tries to get the parent context by name from the MetricContext registry (the parent context must be registered).

    Automatically adds two tags to the inner context:

    • component: attempts to determine which component type within gobblin-api generated this instance.
    • class: the specific class of the object that generated this instance of Instrumented

      • getMetricContext

      • getMetricContext

        public static MetricContext getMetricContext(State state,
                                             Class<?> klazz,
                                             List<Tag<?>> tags)
        Get a MetricContext to be used by an object needing instrumentation.

        This method will read the property "metrics.context.name" from the input State, and will attempt to find a MetricContext with that name in the global instance of GobblinMetricsRegistry. If it succeeds, the generated MetricContext will be a child of the retrieved Context, otherwise it will be a parent-less context.

        The method will automatically add two tags to the context:

        • construct will contain the name of the Constructs that klazz represents.
        • class will contain the canonical name of the input class.

        Parameters:
        state - State used to find the parent MetricContext.
        klazz - Class of the object needing instrumentation.
        tags - Additional tags to add to the returned context.
        Returns:
        A MetricContext with the appropriate tags and parent.

      • newContextFromReferenceContext

        public static MetricContext newContextFromReferenceContext(MetricContext context,
                                                           List<Tag<?>> newTags,
                                                           Optional<String> name)
        Generates a new MetricContext with the parent and tags taken from the reference context. Allows replacing Tag with new input tags. This method will not copy any Metric contained in the reference MetricContext.
        Parameters:
        context - Reference MetricContext.
        newTags - New Tag to apply to context. Repeated keys will override old tags.
        name - Name of the new MetricContext. If absent or empty, will modify old name by adding a random integer at the end.
        Returns:
        Generated MetricContext.

      • isLineageInstrumented

        public static boolean isLineageInstrumented(Object obj)
        Determines whether an object or, if it is a Decorator, any object on its lineage, is of class Instrumentable.
        Parameters:
        obj - Object to analyze.
        Returns:
        Whether the lineage is instrumented.

      • switchMetricContext

        public void switchMetricContext(List<Tag<?>> tags)
        Description copied from interface: Instrumentable
        Generate a new MetricContext replacing old Tag with input Tag (only tags with the same keys will be replaced), and recreate all metrics in this new context.

        This method is useful when the state of the Instrumentable changes and the user wants that state change to be reflected in the tags of the instrumentation.

        Notice that this method creates a brand new MetricContext and Metric every time it is called, with the associated processing and memory overhead. Use sparingly only for state changes that must be visible in emitted metrics.

        Specified by:
        switchMetricContext in interface Instrumentable
        Parameters:
        tags - additional Tag.

      • switchMetricContext

        public void switchMetricContext(MetricContext context)
        Description copied from interface: Instrumentable
        Switches the existing MetricContext with the supplied metric context and regenerates Metric.

        This method is useful when the state of the Instrumentable changes and the user wants that state change to be reflected in the set of Tag of the instrumentation.

        This method is an alternative to Instrumentable.switchMetricContext(List) when metric context switching is done often between a small set of contexts. The subclass should keep a list of previously generated contexts as a cache, and call this method to simply switch between the different contexts, avoiding the overhead of generating a brand new context every time a metric context switch is required.

        Specified by:
        switchMetricContext in interface Instrumentable
        Parameters:
        context - new MetricContext.
